messages.subject: Re: intro/waldorf homeschooling sites
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Linda, Yes I went there maybe you have to go to the web site and join first before they let you in? It would be under Waldorf homeschooling. It is a quiet
messages.messageBody:
Hi Linda,
Yes I went there maybe you have to go to the web site and join first before
they let you in? It would be under Waldorf homeschooling. It is a quiet and
new list. I just gleaned this web site off them today are you familiar with
it?
http://www.users.bigpond.com/goldenbeetlebooks/#MATH
Are you familiar with the Golden Beetle Books Linda or Laura or anyone
else? They look interesting are they geared for older kids?
Beth

messages.messageBody:
Oops I went to the wrong forum but just found the one Laura posted though it
is open to everyone over age 17 and newbies too. Here is the web link
http://onelist.com/community/WE_HS
the one below is from a group of long timers still worth lurking on to try
and glean any interesting stuff like a cool dragon web site I found for kids
with games and activities http://website.lineone.net/~joethedragon/
Beth

messages.subject: Re: intro/waldorf homeschooling sites
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Laura, I went to onelist not through this link http://www.onelist.com/community/waldorfhomeschoolers A discussion forum and resource community for persons
messages.messageBody:
Hi Laura,
I went to onelist not through this link
http://www.onelist.com/community/waldorfhomeschoolers
A discussion forum and resource community for persons interested in
home/unschooling with an emphasis on the Waldorf school curriculum and the
pedagogical ideals of Rudolf Steiner who said "The true aim of education is
to awaken real powers of perception and judgment in relation to life and
living. For only such an awakening can lead to true freedom." If you are new
to the Waldorf philosophy, please visit the following site for more
information before joining our forum.
http://www.chickpages.com/veggiefarm/hedgehogfarms/WISH.com
>

Is this the forum you were talking about? It sounds fun I will definitely
check it out. Happy to see you here and hope you'll share your wisdom and
experiences with us !
Beth

messages.subject: intro/waldorf homeschooling sites
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings, I m Laura from Massachusetts, mom of six (15,13,11,9,7 and 2).  We ve been homeschooling for seven years.  Eldest attends private high school and 9
messages.messageBody:
Greetings,

I'm Laura from Massachusetts, mom of six (15,13,11,9,7 and 2). We've been
homeschooling for seven years. Eldest attends private high school and 9
year old began ps last year by choice. We've used Oak Meadow and other
resources over the years, quite loosely. We seem to slide more into
child-led learning as the years pass by.

For those interested in combining waldorf with homeschooling try the waldorf
homeschoolers list WE_HS@onelist.com. I believe that you can access many
waldorf links through this site.

Warmly,
Laura
